articles.title: Apple stock surges on tariff pause despite China exclusion
articles.content: US President Trump temporarily walked back his tariff policy on all countries except China. Apple (AAPL) was among the names to surge on the announcement despite its significant reliance on China for sourcing. TECHnalysis Research president and chief analyst Bob O'Donnell joins Morning Domination Overtime with Josh Lipton to discuss the stock move, the impact of Trump's tariffs on the iPhone maker, and whether the president could grant the company a tariff exception. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

articles.title: Analysts rework Apple stock price target amid tariff troubles
articles.content: This is what could happen next to Apple shares.

articles.title: Apple soars 15% as Trump reverses on most tariffs
articles.content: Investing.com -- Apple shares soared over 15% on Wednesday after President Trump announced a 90-day pause in reciprocal tariffs for all countries besides China. For China, the rate will go up to 125%. Other countries will have a base rate of 10% during the negotiation period.

articles.title: Apple Stock Jumps on Tariff News, Hope for Exemption
articles.content: President Donald Trump is raising China’s tariff rate to 125% but also said he is considering excluding imports by some companies.

articles.title: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Walmart, Apple, Tesla, Delta, Bristol Myers, Nvidia, Ford, and More
articles.content: Walmart, Apple, Tesla, and Nvidia shares jump after President Donald Trump says he will be delaying tariffs above 10% on some countries for 90 days.

articles.title: US stocks stage historic rally as Trump's 90-day pause takes worst case scenario 'off the table'
articles.content: Stocks wanted one thing from Trump after last week's shocking "Liberation Day" announcement. On Wednesday, they got it.

articles.title: Apple’s Margins Are Still a Big Risk in Trade War Roller Coaster: Heard on the Street
articles.content: Few companies have capitalized on a globalized economy better than Apple.  Apple’s share price surged more than 15% Wednesday after President Trump announced a 90-day pause on many of the tariffs he put in place last week.  Apple’s share price remains 11% down since last week’s shock tariff announcement while most of its megacap tech peers have now fully recovered their losses.

articles.title: Why Aren't You Buying the Dip in Apple?
articles.content: Apple has become oversold, with its Relative Strength Index under 30. History says that you should buy the stock.

articles.title: Apple’s Next Move? Pushing Back on Trump with iPhone Tariff Surcharges
articles.content: Apple has tried to appease the Trump administration to no avail. It has one move left: surcharges on iPhones, attaching them directly to the cost of tariffs.

articles.title: The tech world aggressively backed Trump. It couldn't stop his tariffs.
articles.content: The tech industry tried to cozy up to the Trump Administration in the hopes that it could avoid getting caught in the crossfire of his policy moves. But they couldn't dodge his tariffs.
